result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse S. Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse S. Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:32 a.m. Defendant Jesse S. Cooper in court, in custody, with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Michlig speaks to joint resolution. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1. Rielly statement to sentencing. Court statement; does not impose costs/surcharges.

Court sentence
9 mos. county jail/concurrent with Wisconsin prison sentence
Appeal rights
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.

03:07 pm - Defendant Jesse S. Cooper in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Defendant Jesse S. Cooper in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Information.  Rielly in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

02:15 pm - Defendant Jesse S. Cooper in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Defendant Jesse S. Cooper in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jesse S. Cooper in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:11
In receipt, waive reading - time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

01:44 pm - Defendant Jesse S. Cooper in court, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
